function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Conflicting recommendations on temperature and humidity setpoints from different guidelines","Impact":"Confusion and potential incorrect settings that could impact disease transmission","Mitigation":"Consult with a qualified environmental expert to determine the best setpoints for the specific building and conditions","Technologies":"Environmental monitoring systems for real-time data and analysis","People":"Building managers, HVAC technicians, and environmental experts","Owner":"Building management, environmental consulting firms"},{"Description":"Unclear ventilation rate guidelines for minimizing infectious disease risk","Impact":"Inadequate ventilation leading to increased concentration of airborne particulate matter and virus transmission","Mitigation":"Conduct a comprehensive ventilation assessment and consider the use of air purifiers and UV lamps","Technologies":"Air quality sensors, air purifiers, UV lamps","People":"HVAC technicians, ventilation specialists, building managers","Owner":"Building management, HVAC companies, ventilation specialists"},{"Description":"Controversy over the effectiveness of temperature and humidity changes in inactivating the virus","Impact":"Potential incorrect adjustments that do not effectively inactivate the virus, leading to increased risk of transmission","Mitigation":"Consult with researchers and disease experts to understand the latest findings on temperature and humidity effects on virus inactivation","Technologies":"Temperature and humidity sensors, environmental monitoring systems","People":"Building managers, HVAC technicians, disease researchers","Owner":"Building management, disease research institutions"}]}
